item.title: [ 42] >try linux >be in some program/browser that allows uploading/downloading image
item.description:
>try linux
>be in some program/browser that allows uploading/downloading images
>click upload/download
>the file manager that pops up is not the same as the normal file manager
>it's one with less features
>can't see thumbnails for shit, for example

oh my god this is ARCHAIC
WHAT THE FUCK
How do linux users STILL have two different versions of the file manager: one with full features, and a shitty one for uploading and downloading? When Windows started using the fully featured file manager for either case like 15 YEARS AGO

holy shit this is embarrassing

item.title: [292] Why is tech literacy so low in the current generation? For reference, Stardew
item.description:
Why is tech literacy so low in the current generation?
For reference, Stardew modding never requires you to do anything more than download a file, drag it to a folder and extracting it, and then in the case of the modding API, clicking it once.
There are multiple guides everywhere including on every modpage and the modding API page, but even without them the process is as simple as it could possibly get.

What has caused this sudden steep decline in basic tech literacy? This is as simple as following steps on a screen. Will newer generations bounce back?

Original filename: stardewmods.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [100] /ptg/ Private Trackers General
item.description:
êëàêê¨yjak edition

>Not sure what private trackers are all about?
A private tracker is a torrent website that provides the same functionality as a public tracker but is invite-only. Each member share common goals: collecting, preserving and discussing media.

>Have a question?
- FAQ https://archive.is/UVQkn
- WIKI https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki/Private_trackers
- STUDY https://www.cambridge.org/core/services/aop-cambridge-core/content/view/2F379FE0CB50DF502F0075119FD3E060
- SPREADSHEET https://hdvinnie.github.io/Private-Trackers-Spreadsheet/
- TEN CURRY COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/dBbdE73M
- TEN NEON COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/Ud2pGYaE
- IRC irc://https://irc.sageru.org#ptg

Use >>>/g/ptg as a link to find the /ptg/ thread.

>Remember the following:
>READ THE OP BEFORE MAKING A FUCKING QUESTION YOU RETARDED FAGGOT
>It doesn't matter if you use the same username in different trackers, the staff still share your IP with each other.
>Staff is reading, being /marked/ is NOT a meme, and even if it is, it isn't.
>Don't ask for invites, it's private for a reason.
>If starting out you should interview for RED, rank to TM, wait on account age and get invites from there. THAT'S IT THAT IS ALL YOU HAVE TO DO
>Bonus points are for hoarding, not for spending.
>When the website dies, you will be able to migrate your bp and buffer to animeZ
>the easiest way into trackers is a time machine

>„ÄêNEWS„Äë
ask someone who gives a shit lol

item.title: [274] /pcbg/ - PC Building General
item.description:
>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE
Post build list or current specs including MONITOR: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Provide specific use cases (e.g. 4K editing, high FPS gaming)
State budget and COUNTRY or you will not be helped

NEWS
>RTX 5060, RX 9060 XT, and Arc B770 expected with Computex

>12VHPWR
If a 12VHPWR connector is not fully seated in its socket, the connection can melt.
Do not use aftermarket cables or adapters.

>Intel Raptor Lake / RPL Refresh
Instability reported with 13th and 14th gen, i5 K SKUs and above (incl non-K). Update BIOS and apply Intel Baseline settings. Avoid purchases.

>CPUS
HTPC(4K60)/Web Browsing: i3 12100T
Gaming: R5 9600X; budget: i5 13400; eXtreme: R7 7800X3D
Multicore: Ultra 7 265K; budget: Ultra 5 235; destitute: i5 13400
>Avoid iGPU-less CPUs
>Existing AM4 board with an old chip? Consider a Zen 3 CPU

>GRAPHICS CARDS (@MSRP)
1080p: RTX 3060 12 GB / RTX 4060; ultra budget: used RTX 2060 Super
1440p: RTX 5070; RT: RTX 5070 Ti
2160p: RTX 5080; budget: RTX 5070 Ti
RX 9070 XT: reasonable if at least 33% cheaper than an RTX 5070 Ti or close to price of RTX 5070
Amateur production: RTX 3060 12GB, RTX 5060 Ti 16GB, used RTX 3090, used RTX 4090, RTX 5090

>RAM
DDR4: Zen3/AM4 - 2x 16GB 3600 MT/s CL18; for locked "non-K" 12th/13th/LGA1700 - 2x 16GB 3200 MT/s CL16
DDR5: Zen4/AM5 - 2x 16GB 6000 MT/s CL30; for Core Ultra/LGA1851 - 2x 16GB 6400MT/s CL32

>COOLERS
Thermalright Phantom Spirit (or variant), Thermaltake Frozen Prism

>PSUS
A new PSU should be ATX 3.1 compliant
Aim for 50-75% PSU utilization at full system load
https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/

>SSDS
WD SN5000 2 TB, Samsung 990 Pro 2 TB
Avoid: cheapest NVMe SSDs
https://ssd.borecraft.com/

>MOTHERBOARDS
Good power delivery is required for Intel CPUs like the i5 13600K and above
Generally don't pair a K CPU with a B mobo chipset

>GAMING MONITORS
AOC Q27G3XMN, MSI MPG 321URX
https://pcpartpicker.com/user/pcbg/saved/dP3v4D

Prev: >>105225479

Original filename: Screenshot_2021-04-13 ZeptoBars.png

item.title: [ 31] How in fuck are Croissants so cheap to buy yet are such a bitch to make?
item.description:
>Expensive as fuck to make
>Takes literally 3 days of fucking labor and a shitload of energy to make them
>Super finicky and can fuck up at any point or not come out correctly if you didn't do everything perfectly.
>Somehow sell in stores and cafes for like $2 each
What the fuck is the economics of Croissants? These things are a expensive, super labour intensive, power consuming, finicky piece of shit to make, that takes fucking DAYS to do, and yet they sell for so cheap.

Original filename: lune_croissant_city_fb.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 55] Trump economic approval rating crashes into Hell
item.description:
https://www.newsweek.com/donald-trump-approval-rating-economy-plunges-new-low-2070511
Public confidence regarding President Donald Trump's economic management has declined, a recent poll by The Associated Press shows, even as his overall approval rating experiences a slight uptick since April.

Newsweek contacted Trump's office for comment via online form on Saturday outside of usual working hours.

The May 2025 AP-NORC Center Poll conducted for NORC Center for Public Affairs Research, with funding from The Associated Press and NORC at the University of Chicago, reveals that just over one-third of Americans are confident in Trump's ability to handle the economy and job creation.

When those polled were asked: "Overall, do you approve or disapprove of the way Donald Trump is handling the economy?" of the 1,175 adult respondents, 36 percent approved, while 63 percent disapproved.

This marks a decrease from earlier in the year, which may reflect growing skepticism amid rising tariffs and persistent inflation concerns.

As previously reported by Newsweek, Trump began his second term with higher approval ratings than ever. But, in recent weeks, polls have started to show his popularity rating decline after he released his new program of "Liberation Day" tariffs, which rocked markets and heightened concerns about inflation and a possible recession.

Trump's economic message, built around tax cuts, deregulation, and an "America First" trade policy, has historically served as his political stronghold. Even when his overall approval slipped, he consistently earned his strongest support from voters on economic issues.

As reported by The Associated Press, during Trump's first term, the economy was an issue on which Americans frequently gave him good marks. In October 2020, just before he lost reelection, an AP-NORC poll found that about half of U.S. adults approved of Trump's handling of the economy.

Original filename: 1742256737999496.jpg

item.title: [175] White House considers suspending habeas corpus
item.description:
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c0qgz18glljo

Donald Trump's administration is "actively looking at" suspending habeas corpus - the right of a person to challenge their detention in court - one of the US president's top aides has said.

Stephen Miller, the White House deputy chief of staff, told reporters on Friday that the US Constitution allowed for the legal liberty to be suspended in times of "rebellion or invasion".

His comments come as judges have sought to challenge some recent detentions made by the Trump administration in an effort to combat illegal immigration, as well as remove dissenting foreign students.

"A lot of it depends on whether the courts do the right thing or not," Miller said.

There are several pending civil cases against the Trump administration's deportation of undocumented migrants based on habeaus corpus.

Most recently, a federal judge ordered the release of a Turkish university student who had been detained for six weeks after writing an article that was critical of Israel.

Last week, another judge ordered a Columbia University student detained over his advocacy for Palestinians be released after a petition on habeas corpus grounds.

However, other judges have sided with the Trump administration in such disputes.

Miller described habeas corpus as a "privilege", and said Congress had already passed a law stripping judicial courts of jurisdiction over immigration cases.

Legal experts and critics have questioned the veracity of his interpretation of US law.

"Congress has the authority to suspend habeas corpus - not Stephen Miller, not the president," Marc Elias, an attorney for the Democratic Party, told MSNBC.

item.title: [ 62] FASCIST DICTATOR trump arresting political enemies
item.description:
The FASCIST DICTATOR Donald Dump Trump is arresting his political enemies for standing up for GOOD, proving he is enacting an evil billionaire agenda
https://www.rawstory.com/ras-baraka/
‚ÄòI didn‚Äôt break any laws‚Äô: Newark mayor slams ‚Äòhumiliating‚Äô arrest at ICE facility

Ras Baraka, the Democratic mayor of Newark, New Jersey, didn‚Äôt waste any time defending himself after his arrest outside an ICE facility sparked a chaotic scene that included protesters and several members of Congress who were on site.

‚ÄúIt was really humiliating and painful,‚Äù Baraka, who said he's now facing a federal trespassing charge, told CNN‚Äôs Kaitlan Collins on Friday.

Speaking out just hours after his release from federal custody, Baraka, a candidate for governor of New York, took to CNN to tell his side of the story ‚Äì and denounce the charges. He said he was there in support of members of Congress and his capacity as mayor, not to protest, and was wrongfully ‚Äútargeted.‚Äù

‚ÄúAfter they told us to leave, we left and they began to try to arrest me,‚Äù Baraka said. ‚ÄúI shouldn't say us. They targeted me and came after me specifically and arrested me.‚Äù He also slammed comments from Alina Habba, acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey and longtime Trump ally, that accused the Newark mayor of ignoring multiple warnings.

‚ÄúThe reality is, Alina Habba wasn't there,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúShe doesn't know what happened. I was there for over an hour in that space, and nobody ever told me to move."

GET THE NEW RAW STORY APP.

‚ÄúNot a single person,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúNot an officer from ICE, not any of the security guards, nobody told me to leave that place.‚Äù

But Baraka said he has no regrets.

‚ÄúI don't have any regrets at all,‚Äù Baraka told Collins. ‚ÄúI would do it again. I have a right to go to those facilities as the mayor of the city.‚Äù

item.title: [ 84] Luigi was right
item.description:
>The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash [to the shooting] prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/08/unitedhealthcare-sued-by-shareholders-over-reaction-to-ceos-killing.html

A group of investors sued UnitedHealthcare Group

on Wednesday, accusing the company of misleading them after the killing of its CEO, Brian Thompson.

The class action lawsuit ‚Äî filed in the Southern District of New York ‚Äî accuses the health insurance company of not initially adjusting their 2025 net earning outlook to factor in how Thompson's killing would affect their operations.

On Dec. 3 ‚Äî a day before Thompson was fatally shot ‚Äî the company issued guidance that included net earnings of $28.15 to $28.65 per share and adjusted net earnings of $29.50 to $30.00 per share, the suit notes. And on January 16, the company announced that it was sticking with its old forecast.

The investors described this as "materially false and misleading," pointing to the immense public scrutiny the company and the broader health insurance industry experienced in the wake of Thompson's killing.

The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

"As such, the Company was deliberately reckless in doubling down on its previously issued guidance," the suit reads.

Original filename: file.jpg

item.title: [218] /cfb/ - Not so fast! edition
item.description:
>Michigan Coach Suspension
Sherrone Moore faces a reported two-game suspension due to the Connor Stalions scandal, missing games against Central Michigan and Nebraska but allowed to coach against Oklahoma.

>Lee Corso‚Äôs Retirement
Longtime ESPN College GameDay analyst Lee Corso will retire after Week 1 of the 2025 season, marking the end of an era.

>NCAA Governance Changes Proposed
NCAA President Charlie Baker announced plans for a new governance structure to be released in July, granting individual sports more control over their rules and policies. This aims to give Power 4 conferences greater influence.

>House v. NCAA Settlement Update
A new brief in the House v. NCAA case includes provisions to grandfather in athletes affected by roster cuts for the 2025-26 season, allowing reinstatement at schools' discretion.

>Nico Iamaleava Transfer Drama
Former Tennessee QB Nico Iamaleava‚Äôs transfer to UCLA continues to make waves, with Arkansas‚Äô NIL collective seeking a $200K buyout from him and another player.

>Clemson‚Äôs Unique Addition
Ian Schieffelin, a basketball player, accepted coach Dabo Swinney‚Äôs offer to join Clemson‚Äôs football team, forgoing pro basketball for now.

>Transfer Portal Highlights
The spring transfer window closed, but top uncommitted prospects remain, with teams like UNLV and Tulane boosting rosters for playoff hopes.

>Recruiting News
The Class of 2026 five-star recruits are shaping up, with May expected to bring significant commitments.

item.title: [218] /tpg/ /rcg/ - Theme Park & Roller Coaster General
item.description:
Disneyland Abu Dhabi Edition

>Last Thread: >>2779327

>What is this thread? Why are there two companies?
Disney parks were initially founded as a way to celebrate the culture and history of America and provide middle class families with a fun-filled immersive experience. While theme parks are the main focus of these threads (and the title of the general) there is also discussion on other roller coasters & rides, as well as the parks themselves and trip planning too. That's where /rcg/ comes in.
>Can I talk about Disney/Universal parks in this thread?
Absolutely! Disney and Universal are currently competing for the Orlando theme park market and beyond! Universal is opening new resorts all around the US and new continents!

item.title: [ 70] Anybody from a third-world country ever (legally) travel to the US?
item.description:
Is it really as hard as it seems? My friend in Colombia is trying to visit the US but it seems unreasonably hard to get a tourist visa. Do they really require an in-person interview at the US embassy in Bogota? He doesn't live anywhere near Bogota, how is that reasonable to expect him to travel all the way to Bogota ? Is there any way around that or can he do the interview over the phone? He's just trying to get a tourist visa, not become an immigrant, so why make him pay for a flight and take extra days off work just for a tourist visa?

And how long does it actually take to get a tourist visa approved? How long in advance does he need to plan the trip?

item.title: [229] /out/ings with a pipe
item.description:
Old thread: >>2774508

This is a thread for enjoying a pipe while doing outdoor activities. If you ask why this belongs on /out/, you've never spent an evening by the campfire with a pipe silently enjoying the nature around you, and you're missing out.

>how to get started
Purchase a Missouri Meerschaum Legend and a pouch of Half and Half or Captain Black tobacco, available at most smoke shops. You will need a lighter or match, and something to tamp it with--a large nail works well if you don't have a pipe tool. Fill the pipe with tobacco, pack it down halfway, top it off, pack it down to 3/4, top it off again, pack gently and enjoy. Smoke slower than you think you need to, the tobacco tastes best when it is burning cool. Tamp and re-light as needed. If you still have trouble, try different methods on YouTube until you find one that works for you.

>smoking a pipe will give you cancer
While any tobacco consumption comes with some risk, the cancer risks from occasional pipe use are pretty minimal. Educate yourself and make your own informed health decisions. Some info here https://aacrjournals.org/cancerpreventionresearch/article/10/12/704/46541/Association-between-Cigar-or-Pipe-Smoking-and

>muh weed
Not the time or place. Start your own thread

>I DON‚ÄôT LIKE WHAT YOU LIKE REEEEEE
Then leave the thread. Pipes have been a part of outdoors culture for centuries. If you don‚Äôt like it, leave.
